name: stupefied
content:
stupefied adjective
(TIRED)
Add to word list
Add to word list
unable to think clearly, usually because someone is extremely tired or bored, or has taken drugs: Stupefied by tiredness, she just sat in front of the fire. As they slept in a stupefied state, someone stole all their belongings.
More examplesFewer examplesThe pain had faded into the background and she was starting to feel stupefied, her eyes heavy.He'd been smoking dope, and was quite stupefied.He woke stupefied, flicking his tongue over his parched lips like a reptile.

stupefied adjective
(SURPRISED)
very surprised or shocked: We were so stupefied by the news that we all sat in silence for a long time. She was stupefied to learn that he didn't know how to make his bed.
More examplesFewer examplesShe said she was stupefied by the incident. Somewhat stupefied, I asked her how she knew so much about art. I am stupefied that the Party would stoop to such a level.
